column1: It is said that loons have been caught in the New York lakes eighty feet beneath the surface
column2: with hooks set for trout—though Walden is deeper than that. How surprised must the fishes be to see this ungainly visitor from another sphere speeding his way amid their schools! Yet he appeared to know his course as surely under water as on the surface
column3: and swam much faster there. Once or twice I saw a ripple where he approached the surface
column4: just put his head out to reconnoiter
column5: and instantly dived again. I found that it was as well for me to rest on my oars and wait his reappearing as to endeavor to calculate where he would rise; for again and again
column6: when I was straining my eyes over the surface one way
column7: I would suddenly be startled by his unearthly laugh behind me.
